page.title: 19 The Post Office.
page.content: This is the most important place in the village. Nearly everybody visits the Post Office at some time during the week. Apart from the usual Post Office services, sweets, ice cream, cigarettes and tobacco are sold there. There is also a small stock of stationery items and patent medicines. For the benefit of those unable to visit the town there is selection of fruit and vegetables in season. The sub-postmistress is Mrs. May Thorne who took over when her husband died. She is also a state registered nurse and a midwife. The Post Office is also an advice and information centre for residents and visitors and has an important place in the community as a source of assistance.There are two postal collections and deliveries on weekdays but only one on Saturdays.
